text.p: These are the leading stories in the Sarajevo press on Tuesday. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.

- The British Agency for Overseas Development (ODA) and its chairman Baroness Linda Chalker and were decorated by "Golden Bosnian coat of arms" medal in Sarajevo on Monday for helping Bosnia and its citizens during the war.

- Ericsson digital telephone switchboard with 20,000 new numbers starts operating in Sarajevo on Tuesday as a result of two-year-long cooperation between the Swedish telecommunications company and Bosnia's PTT services.
- $30 million project for rehabilitation of health care in Bosnia will help the reconstruction of 60 health institutions treating war trauma.
- Draft plan to revive Bosnia's economy was presented on Monday during a meeting between senior World Bank officials and Bosnian representatives in Sarajevo.
- European Community Humanitarian Office (ECHO) donated 367,000 German marks for reconstruction of an elementary school, emergency room and water utilities in Praca, east Bosnia.
